sub_title: Biokineticist / Exercise Specialist / Clinical Exercise Physiologist / Aqua Therapist / Watsu Provider
summary:
As a biokineticist (bio = life, kineticist = through movement), I am committed to providing patients with effective evaluations, interventions, and individualised exercise treatment plans to help empower them in achieving their movement goals. In my experience, empowerment is also largely attained through truly being able to tune in to and listen to one's body.

After 5 years of human movement study, and a number of years' experience in running my own practice, I have gained fundamental experience in working with patients 16 - 95 years old struggling with a variety of orthopaedic and chronic disease issues. I have used my passion for both aqua and land therapy, as well as my empathetic, patient, and listener-mindset to connect with their goals, needs, and desires on a human level.

I find it fundamental to work in a multidisciplinary team in order to assist patients struggling with physical injuries in managing their pain and improving their range of movement, strength and rehabilitative outcomes. In this way, we are able to place the patient at the very heart of everything we do.

company.name: Christa Kruger Biokineticist t/a The Movement Space

profile_positions.location: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
profile_positions.company: Christa Kruger Biokineticist t/a The Movement Space
profile_positions.description:
Managing and running my own private biokinetics practice making use of home visits, gym sessions, aqua therapy (including Watsu®), and telehealth in the Sea Point and Noordhoek areas of Cape Town, South Africa. Assessing and treating patients with a variety of orthopaedic, neurological as well as chronic and cardiac disease rehabilitation needs, and conducting all necessary administrative duties (session documentation, report writing, session scheduling, patient recruitment, financial administration etc.).

Some examples of the patient populations treated:
Parkinson’s disease, muscular dystrophy, stroke (CVA), oncology, history of polio, post COVID-19 (including long-term complaints post COVID-19), asthma, pulmonary hypertension, fibromyalgia, pregnancy, scoliosis, lower back pain, sciatica, spinal stenosis / fusion, osteoarthritis, osteoporosis, shoulder rehab (e.g. rotator cuff syndrome), elbow rehab (e.g. medial and lateral epicondylitis), 6-8 weeks post hip/knee replacement, sprains and strains, ankle rehab, knee rehab (ACL, meniscal tears, tendinopathies, CMP).

Patient evaluations involving a focus on one or more of the following:
Biomechanical and musculoskeletal assessments (strength, endurance, range of motion, posture); analysis of activities of daily living, gait and specific motor acts; evaluation of perception and gross motor function; anthropometric assessments.

Gym sessions in Sea Point took place at the facilities of First Principles Gym from 2015-2022. 
Aqua therapy took place at the facilities of Debbie Grusd Physiotherapy (Sea Point) from 2016-2022. 
Aqua therapy took place at the facilities of Adele Pudney Physiotherapists (Noordhoek) from 2019-2021. 
Gym sessions in Noordhoek took place at the facilities of 3S Functional Training Studio from 2021-2023.
profile_positions.title: Biokineticist

profile_positions.location: Sea Point, Cape Town, South Africa
profile_positions.description:
The U-Turn Chronic Disease Risk Reduction and Reversal program was a lifestyle intervention programme initially based at the Clinical Sport and Exercise Medicine Practice (located at the Sports Science Institute of South Africa in Newlands, Cape Town). We relocated the program to the Bio-Dynamics Institute, Sea Point, Cape Town in 2016.

The programme catered for patients with established chronic disease including cardiovascular disease, diabetes mellitus, chronic respiratory disease, cancer, fibromyalgia, chronic renal disorders, myopathies, and joint degeneration. These chronic diseases of lifestyle share risk factors such as unhealthy dietary choices, smoking, lack of physical exercise, sedentary behaviour and life stress.

This medically supervised programme involved a systematic assessment followed by a lifestyle intervention that included supervised exercise to increase the functional capacity and psychological well-being of patients.

Upon entering the programme, each patient was screened and risk stratified by a sport & exercise medicine physician. Patients were then further assessed by a biokineticist before commencing their supervised exercise sessions.

During the completion of their exercise sessions, there was also an educational component where stress management and dietary guidelines were provided. This allowed us to provide patients with the necessary tools to help them realise the worth of their own active participation in the process of making lifestyle changes. The program was designed to prepare the patient to eventually progress to a medically-directed or unsupervised exercise setting.

Primary Responsilibities: co-ordinating the program alongside Prof. Wayne Derman (sports physician). Patient intake and assessments (including stress ECGs), planning and conducting exercise classes, monitoring patients and keeping the physicians up-to-date with patient medical histories and daily symptoms, training and supervising interns, and report writing.
profile_positions.title: Biokineticist

profile_positions.location: Claremont, Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
profile_positions.description:
Husband and wife team, Ryan and Leanne Botha, launched aLoveSupreme in 2014 as a detour from their graphic design agency. They infused aLoveSupreme with their inspired verve, playful sense of humour and non-negotiable commitment to quality every step of the way. Bold, bright and always original, hand-drawn illustrations are the hub of every aLoveSupreme piece – adding some magic to a world besieged with ordinary, run-of-the-mill products. Embracing all things stationery, aLoveSupreme has created a classy collection of notebooks, wrapping paper, gift bags, note cards and gift tags. Branching off into the world of homeware, the range includes cushion covers, tea towels, napkins, bowl covers and paper placemats. Some of their prints are also available as tote bags, pouches, laptop sleeves and towels.

Primary responsibilities: carrying out any and all company and personal tasks required of the CEO, including stock taking/arrangement, website editing, product stand design, product material collection from vendors, and standing in as shop assistant.
profile_positions.title: Personal Assistant to Chief Executive Officer

company.name: Sports Science Institute of South Africa (SSISA)

profile_positions.company: Sports Science Institute of South Africa (SSISA)
profile_positions.description:
Part-time internship of 20hours per week based at the Wellness & Fitness Centre of the Sports Science Institute of South Africa (SSISA) in Newlands, Cape Town, South Africa.

As sports science interns, we had exposure to all the modalities of biokinetics offered within one centre. The Institute has an exceptional internship structure which allows interns to apply themselves to any of the services offered within the biokinetics scope of practice.
 
The divisions in which we gained experience included: general wellness, weight loss, special populations, chronic disease, orthopaedic, Old Mutual Corporate Gym in Pinelands, High Performance Centre, community outreach.

Primary responsibilities: orthopaedic rehabilitation consultations and treatment sessions, clinical and administrative duties (filing, stock administration, invoicing etc.), fitness testing, Pilates instruction, cardiac screening, gym floor supervision and management, healthy weight group programs, Go-4-It individual programs, overseeing and training of honours students.
profile_positions.title: Intern Biokineticist

company.name: Sports and Exercise Medicine Clinic & Clinical Research Centre

profile_positions.company: Sports and Exercise Medicine Clinic & Clinical Research Centre
profile_positions.description:
Part-time internship of 20hours per week based at the Sports and Exercise Medicine Clinic & Clinical Research Centre of the Sports Science Institute of South Africa (SSISA) in Newlands, Cape Town, South Africa.

The Sport and Exercise Medicine practice forms a multi-disciplinary team of professionals offering excellent medical care and advice to help individuals reach their sporting potential or manage their injury or illness. The practice treats highly trained athletes, recreational sports enthusiasts and those who have a medical condition that needs treatment. Services include injury diagnosis and management, general and corporate medicals, concussion screening and assessment and chronic disease rehabilitation programmes.

Primary responsibilities: clinical and administrative duties related to the U-Turn Lifestyle Rehabilitation Program aimed at cardiac and chronic disease rehabilitation (patient initiation and follow-up, exercise program design and prescription, conducting individual and group exercise rehabilitation sessions, adding insight into developing and expanding the program). Exercise stress testing (including ECG’s), lung function testing, doppler and compartment pressure testing, overseeing and training of honours students, administrative duties (filing, stock administration and control, invoicing etc.).

U-Turn Medical was a medically directed programme specialising in lifestyle intervention for patients with chronic disease. This programme catered to patients suffering from a variety of chronic diseases of lifestyle including cardiovascular disease, diabetes mellitus, chronic respiratory disease, cancer, fibromyalgia, chronic renal disorders, myopathies, and joint degeneration.
profile_positions.title: Intern Biokineticist

profile_positions.location: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
profile_positions.description:
Living Lands’ work spans across a wide variety of disciplines, and they adapt to the community they work within. They provide practical support to farmers, enable implementation of large-scale ecological rehabilitation projects, assist with information flow between role players and explore new opportunities in the agricultural-ecological interface.

Primary responsibilities: remote editing of proposals, reports, website text and general documents.
profile_positions.title: Proofreading and Editing of English Text

profile_positions.description:
Radiant Pilates was a pilates studio owned by Dr Sheree Bekker.

Primary responsibilities: Pilates exercise classes and individual sessions for a variety of persons (beginners to intermediates) including those with osteoporosis, scoliosis, fused spines, anorexia, general health concerns, upkeep of fitness, and those involved in specific sports such as ballet.
profile_positions.title: Pilates Mat Instructor

profile_positions.description:
Alet Kruger Multilingual Language Services comprised of an extended network of approximately 200 translators, interpreters, editors (most of whom are accredited with the South African Translators' Institute (SATI) or a similar institution), and experienced linguists. The driving force behind this dynamic company was director and project manager Alet Kruger, an internationally acclaimed academic in the discipline of Translation Studies.

Primary responsibilities: filing, bank statement capturing into QuickBooks Pro, monthly payment of freelancers, monthly Payroll, filing of VAT returns, year-end tax certificates, delivering of documents.
profile_positions.title: Bookkeeper

profile_positions.description:
Above Average Tutoring was a South African-based company providing scholars with tutors, for one-on-one out-of-school help. In this way, they could give undivided attention to scholars in their home environment to help them achieve their best. Their subjects included: Mathematics, Science, Accounting, English, Afrikaans, Art, Biology, Computer Science, Additional Mathematics, Technical Drawing and many more.

Primary responsibilities: preparing and conducting helpful material for one-on-one lessons to assist high school children (13-18 years old) with particular aspects of the subject matter they experienced difficulty with. Subjects that I taught included: Mathematics, Physical Science, and Biology (Natural Science). Creative problem solving, precise and effective communication, and relevant example choice were paramount to delivering the topics in ways that made sense to the child.
profile_positions.title: High School Mathematics, Physical Science, and Biology (Natural Science) Tutor
